question: The most plausible explanation for the location of the Thar desert in western India is
option1: the obstruction caused by the Aravalis to the rain-bearing wind that proceeds to the Ganga Valley
option2: the evaporation of moisture by heat
option3: the absence of mountains to the north of Rajasthan to cause orographic rainfall in it
option4: that the moisture carried by the South-west monsoon is driven away by the dry upper air current
answer: the absence of mountains to the north of Rajasthan to cause orographic rainfall in it
